courses.duties:
The Computing for Medicine program is a program run by the Department of Computer Science and the Faculty of Medicine. The program is designed to introduce medical students to programming and to the applications of computing to medicine. Students will participate in a series of bootcamp-style workshops where they will learn to program in Python and in seminars with a corresponding project on the application of computing to medicine. 
Ideally you should be available for all of the following workshop sessions:
   Sept 20, Oct 4, Oct 18, Nov 22, Dec 6:  9:30 am - 12:30 pm
   Nov 22: 1 - 4 pm
   Dec 20: 12 - 3 pm

In your application, please indicate any dates and times from these sessions when you
are unavailable. To apply for a position, applicants should send a resume/CV 
to mcraig@cs.toronto.edu  with a cc to tacoord@cs.toronto.edu.

The teaching assistants will help the instructors with facilitating the programming workshops.  
Other duties may include marking coursework.
courses.qualifications: Excellent programming skills; thorough knowledge of Python, Excellence in teaching and at least 6 months of experience teaching computer science, Excellent communication skills, Experience with applying computer science in a practical setting and broad knowledge of computer science fundamentals.

courses.duties: TA duties may include marking, leading skills development tutorials, Q&A/Exam/Assignment/Test Review sessions, and laboratories where noted.
courses.qualifications: Must be enrolled in, or have completed, an undergraduate program in computer science or education (or equivalent). Demonstrated excellent English communication skills. Patience teaching technical concepts to students with a wide variety of non-technical backgrounds. Must have completed or be in the process of completing a course involving functional programming. Must be able to write code in the Intermediate Student Language of Racket, and trace it in the same manner as the Intermediate Student Language Stepper of the DrRacket development environment.
